page.title: 14ARABLE AND LIVESTOCK
page.content: By far the greatest land use in the block is for{general farming.}The farms vary considerably in size but there are no very large holdings. There are three{dairy farms}with one of these also keeping sheep. The cattle are all{British Fresian}with the milk being collected by the Milk- Marketing Board for distribution to Bristol and London. { Sheep}are kept extensively,because of the terrain. The largest flock is to be found on Green Farm. Silage making is replacing hay on many livestock farms and the new haylage has also been made this year. The new round hay bales appeared for the first time in 1984. Cereal crops include Winter Barley and Wheat,Spring Barley and Oats. There are{4 Market {Gardens}growing both vegetables and salad crops,selling to local retailers
